newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE sugar firms, activity good for holiday time.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE sugar firms, activity good for holiday time.

text.p: LIFFE sugar futures edged up on Monday in volume which traders described as good considering that many market players were absent ahead of the New Year holiday.
"500 lots on a Monday is not bad," one said.
The market was following New York up, traders said. The rise was no more than a continuation of Friday's trend, they said.
There was some fund buying pushing prices up, but there were sellers above the market to limit gains.
By 1605 GMT, 468 lots had been traded. Front month March was $2.2 higher at $309.40, on volume of 381 lots, which made it by far the most active contract.

On the fundamentals front, Pakistan's sugar production for 1996/97 (July/June) fell 42.87 percent to 388,272 tonnes by December 15 compared to 679,635 tonnes in the year-ago period, Pakistan Sugar Mills Association said on Monday. --Christopher Lyddon, London newsroom +44 171 542 7928
